data.text:
BOOK THIS SERVICE ONLINE OR CALL +374 55 68-28-08

During this tour you will get acquainted with the activities of the Aslamazyan sisters, learn about their connection to Gyumri, study the activities of Merkurov, visit different film pavilions ("The Murdered Dove", "The Triangle"), see the mushurba, which is the symbol of Gyumri. The guests will be introduced to the history of memorable events in Gyumri, the famous people of Gyumri in the 18th-19th centuries, the everyday life of Gyumri residents, their culture and healthcare in this period.

Church of the Holy Archangel Michael

The church is named after the canonized Archangel Michael. The church is built of local black stone. It is called "Plplan Jam" because of its shiny pewter dome. The church was consecrated in 1886 by Archbishop Poghos of the Greek-Russian Orthodox Church in Georgia. After the establishment of Soviet power in 1920, the chapel was closed.

Black Fortress

This fortress is a monument in Gyumri, Shirak region of RA. It is a castle built in 1834. As in the case of the underground structures of Ani, underground roads were built to the fortress leading from the fortress to the present-day monument of the Mother of Armenia, the Red Fortress. It is included in the list of immovable monuments of history and culture of Gyumri.

The Old Theater Building

The old white building of the Gyumri Theater, formerly called the "People's House," is located at the beginning of Gyumri's Central Park. This 150-year-old building was built at the expense of the residents of Alexandropol. Over time it became the main venue of folk events. Armen Tigranian's first opera "Anush" was first performed here in 1912.

The building of the dowry

As the people say, "The House of Dowry" was built in 1910 by the rich Drambyan from Alexandropol. He originally built the building as a house to give a dowry to his daughter Jahavir, who married Gegham Margar Ter-Petrosian, the first political leader of Alexandropol. The house has two floors and has a gorgeous staircase leading from the first floor to the first floor.

Avetik Isahakyan House-Museum

On October 29, 1975, on the 100th anniversary of the great Master's birth, the house of Isahakyan became a memorial museum. In the early 1990s the museum building was completely demolished to build a new building in the same architectural style, but construction was halted soon after, for more than a decade. The restoration commissioned by the Shirak province administration began in earnest in the spring of 2002, opening its hospitable doors to all.

Hovhannes Shiraz Memorial Museum

The house was dedicated to the great Armenian poet Hovhannes Shiraz and was built in July of 1983. However, the poet did not live in this house. He died in March 1984. The building was built in 1886 and was the home of a wealthy merchant.

The church "Yot Verk" of St. Astvatsatsin

The Church of St. Astvatsatsin or the Church of the Seven Ranks is located in Gyumri, Shirak province, RA. It was built in 1874-1886 and is located in the central square of the city, now Vardanants. The church is the Diocese of Shirak. The official name of the church is Surb Astvatsatsin, but locals know it as the Seven Wounds in honor of the picture of the Virgin Mary transferred here from Surb Nshan Church.

Church of St. Amenaprkich

The church was built in the 1860s, with construction completed in 1873. The architect of the building is Tados Antikyan. The Savior was built in the likeness of the Mother Cathedral of Ani. Next to the church there was an Armenian parish school. The school building was demolished during the Soviet years. During the Soviet years, the church served as a philharmonic hall. The church was partially destroyed during the 1988 earthquake. In 2014, the church was restored to its appearance. In 2014. June 21, Garegin II consecrated the crosses of the church and placed them on the dome and bell tower.

Park of Copies of Destroyed Armenian Khachkars in Jugha

The park was built in 2010 near the Amenaprkich Church. The cross-stones are typical of medieval Armenian Christian art. The Gyumri cross-stones are carved and placed here to commemorate the hundreds of Armenian cross-stones that were destroyed by Azerbaijanis in Jugha. The tour will feature memorable events from Gyumri's history, famous people from Gyumri, 18th-19th century Gyumri with its culture, humor and symbols.

IMPORTANT TO KNOW

The purchase/booking of this service is with CONFIRMATION. Within 24 hours of your purchase/booking, you will receive a confirmation or non-confirmation email.

In case of a complete purchase, a few minutes after the purchase is made and the platform receives a confirmation letter, from your bank card/wallet the full amount of the service will be charged.

In case of purchasing a booking voucher, a few minutes after making the purchase and receiving the confirmation letter from the platform, funds will be charged from your bank card/wallet in the amount of the voucher.
